meanings.definition: To apply a new coat of paint or other covering to (something)
meanings.sent1: She recoats the fence every summer to keep it looking fresh.
meanings.sent2: He recoats his bicycle with a shiny layer of paint.
meanings.sent3: The artist recoats the canvas, turning it into a colorful masterpiece.
meanings.sent4: The sun slowly recoats the sky with hues of orange and pink at sunset.
meanings.sent5: The chef recoats the chicken with a flavorful marinade before grilling.

meanings.definition: To cover again with a coat
meanings.sent1: After the rain, she recoats the driveway with a layer of gravel.
meanings.sent2: He recoats the table with a fresh varnish to protect it from scratches.
meanings.sent3: The cat playfully recoats itself in fur after grooming.
meanings.sent4: Time slowly recoats memories with a layer of nostalgia.
meanings.sent5: The gardener recoats the fence with a weather-resistant sealant to prevent damage.
